--- title: "About" subtitle: "Assistant Professor (tenure track) in Lifespan Developmental Psychology (adult development with a focus on technology and/ or digitalization) at University of Luxembourg." image: "img/stanciu_photo.jpg" about: id: hero-heading template: trestles image-shape: rounded image-width: 25em links: - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/adrianvstanciu - icon: google text: Scholar href: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=vy80cu8AAAAJ&hl=en - icon: map text: Research Gate href: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Adrian-Stanciu --- :::{#hero-heading} ## Research interests Ageing, culture, and digital technology. Particular focus on ageing migrants. ## Bio Member in the ALLBUS team ([German General Social Survey](https://www.gesis.org/en/allbus)) at GESIS - Leibniz Institute for the Social Sciences in Mannheim, Germany. Here, I acquired invaluable expertise into managing large scale surveys in addition to developing an interest in programming for the social sciences using _R_. My direct supervisor was [Oshrat Hochman, PhD](https://www.gesis.org/en/institute/about-us/staff/person/Oshrat.Hochman). At the University of Vechta in Germany, I developed my research agenda on migration and ageing. [Prof. Dr. Maria Pavlova](https://www.uni-vechta.de/gerontologie/personen/prof-dr-maria-pavlova) was my direct employer. My PhD studies were at Bremen International School of Social Sciences ([BIGSSS](https://www.bigsss-bremen.de/)). The doctoral title was conferred by University of Bremen and Jacobs University Bremen (now Constructor University Bremen). I studied Sociology at the Bachelor level in Bucharest, Romania. I hold a Master's degree in Social Psychology from University of Groningen, the Netherlands. I speak Romanian, English and German fluently. I currently learn French and Brazilian Portuguese. I practice Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu since 2021. I am a stroke survivor. ## Contact **Email**: adrian.stanciu[at]uni.lu **Note**: I will not consider nor respond to unsolicited work inquiries, traineeship and any form of collaboration that involves financial efforts on my part or the institution I represent. For all such collaborations, only applications and requests via the official channels will be considered. ## Counter ::: {.cell} ::: Counter
(Non-unique) Visits since last website update: 04 July 2024
